remarks: Colinear functionals have equal kernels.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Mar-2015.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
lcdlkreq2.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lcdlkreq2.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcdlkreq2.s $e |- S = ( Scalar ` U ) $.
lcdlkreq2.r $e |- R = ( Base ` S ) $.
lcdlkreq2.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` S ) $.
lcdlkreq2.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lcdlkreq2.c $e |- C = ( ( LCDual ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcdlkreq2.v $e |- V = ( Base ` C ) $.
lcdlkreq2.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` C ) $.
lcdlkreq2.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lcdlkreq2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( R \ { .0. } ) ) $.
lcdlkreq2.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. V ) $.
lcdlkreq2.g $e |- ( ph -> G = ( A .x. I ) ) $.
lcdlkreq2N $p |- ( ph -> ( L ` G ) = ( L ` I ) ) $.
